posts.name: Guilherme
posts.cooked: I’m starting to implement AprilTag detection on my robot and I have some doubts, which is better to use PhotonVision or LimelightOs, and I would also like to know if it is possible for me to use PhotonVision on limelight, because I read the documents of the photon and what made me understand that the limelight would serve as a coprocessor, I couldn’t understand how they would work together, I wanted to ask for your help.

posts.name: Andy Gasser
posts.cooked: The choice is up to you. LimeLight with limelight OS is the easiest. Yes, you can run Photonvision on LimeLight hardware. My team chose to run PhotonVision on an Orange Pi because it supports multiple simultaneous cameras, and global shutter cameras .

posts.name: Guilherme
posts.cooked: So I’m going to choose to use LimelightOS, do you have any code for me to use as a basis to angle the launcher according to AprilTag’s vision, I wanted to create a button so that when it is pressed, it looks at the camera and calculates the best angle for that spot, it wouldn’t need to be something so variable or precise, it could be, for example, between 0 to 5m angleX, from 5 to 7 angleY, and more

posts.name: Guilherme
posts.cooked: Is there any way to do Apriltag recognition without a coprocessor, for example, a Logitech camera and use Roborio to run Photon Vision, or is there another way to make this work?

posts.name: gartaud
posts.cooked: You can sample. Move from 0 to n meters one meter at the time away from the target. Figure out what angle is best at that post. Then plot your samples in a spreadsheet like Excel and find the best curve that fits your data.

posts.name: Guilherme
posts.cooked:
I’m asking, if this button would work for example

For example, the limelightPoseEstimator is the distance variable from the camera to the Tag, to have the angle I want, would it work like this, or would there be some changes?

posts.name: gartaud
posts.cooked:
You should look at this official Limelight example: limelight-examples/java-wpilib/swerve-aim-and-range at main · LimelightVision/limelight-examples · GitHub

It is using measurements to control a drivetrain but you could use a very similar approach to control your shooter.

suggested_topics.fancy_title: Trying to use pathplanner pathfinding, getting error “cannot instantiate Autobuilder”
suggested_topics.title: Trying to use pathplanner pathfinding, getting error "cannot instantiate Autobuilder"
suggested_topics.excerpt: You need to configure AutoBuilder before using AutoBuilder. Try moving your configureAutoBuilder() method to before calling the pathFind method.
